fields.description:
On occasion we have to rewrite the history of our repo due to various reasons, usually we just need to remove a commit or two off the top of the stack.

It would be ideal to have a button that would prevent any pushes to the repo during the time it takes us to identify the commits to remove and rewriting the history of the repo. We want to do this so that any pushes during this time doesn't get lost, etc...

Please let me know if you have any questions, and thank you!

* Jeff
fields.summary: Feature Request - Freeze Repository Button (BB-10392)

||v||/||||v||

Do not work.

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm a new bitbucket user that have seen the possibility to change the UI into French.

I see that I can help to translate the UI, that's cool.

But as I see, the existing translation is not very understandable. As an example the "followers" term is translated by "Suiveurs" which is wrong. It's better to talk about "Abonnés".\\
Same thing with "following" which should be translated by "Abonnements".

Is that possible to change existing translated terms or not? I quickly see on Transifex without any result.

Thanks in advance for the help,

Olivier
fields.summary: Wrong french translation for "followers" and "following"

fields.description:
Hi,

First of all, thanks for this website.  I am a developer and is currently using this to manage my code base.

This issue is, I believe, minor. I am currently deleting my repositories because I intend to re-create all of them and remove those that I don' t want any more. I successfully deleted the first one, and then after deleting the second one, the link to that repository still exists even though I already refreshed the page. Please see attached image.

Thank you for reading this report.
fields.summary: Link to repository in header still exists after being deleted (BB-10418)

fields.description:
The milestone link in comments in issues isn't escaped properly. This causes the URL of a milestone to be invalid (non-working) if certain characters are used that should be url-encoded when using as a parameter.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a milestone with the name "milestone; bug"
# Create issue, not linking to the milestone yet
# Edit the issue and set the milestone to "milestone; bug"
# A new comment will appear like "changed milestone to milestone; bug"
# Look at the URL insert in this comment, and notice that the ";" is not escaped to "%3B" in the 'milestone=' part.
fields.summary: Milestone link missing HTML escaping (BB-10395)

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I think it well be very useful for us (customers) if you add a possibility to send notifications about repository changes using Safari push notifications (so they would be able to appear in notification centre on OS X). I'm pretty sure you know about this, but here is a related page: https://developer.apple.com/notifications/safari-push-notifications/

I really need to know when my repo was changed by other members of my team, so I subscribed to Bitbucket notifications. And now I have full inbox of them. I don't need to have an email. I just want to be notified that the repo was changed.

It would be awesome, if you can implement this.

Thank you in advance,\\
Dan Pristupov
fields.summary: Feature request: Safari push notifications (BB-10393)

fields.description: It would be best, probably in both a Git and Hg scenario, not to show a list of the commits that were stripped. Instead, it would be nice to just say something about an Hg repo having been stripped back to HASH and a Git repo having a "Reference to branch forced to SHA1" or something along those lines. Showing the hashes of a Git repo can be a security issue for users who have accidentally pushed in a password considering you can just hack them into the URL. Also, showing each commit that was stripped just clutters up the newsfeed anyway.
fields.summary: Change event history messaging about stripped events for Hg and Git (BB-7556)

fields.description:
It would be really usefull to have the search funtionality also search the repository description rather than only the repository name.

We have a naming convention to use the JIRA project code as git repository name and add the user-friendly name in the description field. Being able to search that description, would allow us to locate a repository much quicker.
fields.summary: Modify search to also search the repository description (BB-10391)

fields.description:
We use the wiki as a developer documentation for our product but we need also the ability to switch between the documentation based on the product version.

For example, when we tag our product (i.e. Version 1.0) we would also like to tag our wiki and in Bitbucket there should be a drop down where i can switch between _master_ and the _tags_ (in that case "Version 1.0")
fields.summary: Wiki versioning

fields.description:
Currently, all Versions, Milestones, and Components show up in the drop-down lists on the pages to create or edit new Issues. It would be great to be able to mark some of those as "complete" or "inactive" or whatever, so they no longer show up as options. It doesn't make sense to be able to target an issue for a milestone that has passed or a component that no longer exists.

Currently, you can delete an item, but you then lose the history.
fields.summary: Ability to mark a Version, Milestone, or Component as inactive (BB-10376)

fields.description:
I have a personal BitBucket account (martinbean), and various team accounts. If I view a team page, and click the “Create” button to create a repository, the owner is set to my personal account by default.

It would be good that, when creating a repository from a team page, that team name was automatically set in the owner option. I keep forgetting this, and keep creating repositories under owned by my personal account that I intended to create under team accounts.
fields.summary: Pre-populate owner when creating new repo from a team page (BB-10374)

fields.description:

{code}
#!bash

$ hg pull --debug
running ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org "hg -R <redacted/> serve --stdio"
sending hello command
sending between command
remote: 145
remote: capabilities: lookup changegroupsubset branchmap pushkey known getbundle unbundlehash batch stream unbundle=HG10GZ,HG10BZ,HG10UN httpheader=1024
remote: 1
pulling from ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/<redacted/>
query 1; heads
sending batch command

{code}

and it hangs here
fields.summary: hg pull with deployment keys stopped working

Would it be possible to add the ability have a default dummy email address for repository actions. Something along the lines of *{{username}}*{{@users.noreply.bitbucket.com}}.

This way if contributors wanted to keep their email address private the repo admin doesn't have to add an alias for each user.

fields.description:
I've transferred a repo from my account to a team. Now I don't have access to that repo via SSH. I get:

{code:text}
conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

I've update the remotes and so, but that's not the problem. I've the same problem if I try to checkout the code again or execute a ls-remote.

I appear as owner of the repo (lanarvi/pmboknav) and I'm also included in the Admin and Devs groups for the team, which have some permissions granted (I've tested all combinations).

My account seems to be ok, I have no problem with other non-transferred repos, I've tested my ssh credentials, etc.
fields.summary: Problem with SSH after transferring a repo

fields.description: Specifying a Wiki as *public* it will not appear in the menu bar for visitors who are not logged in. But if they know the path [https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/wiki/|https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/wiki/] it becomes visible.

fields.description:
When communicating with Bitbucket through REST, there is no way to get a list of possible assignees for an issue (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/issues+Resource?focusedCommentId=311919730#comment-311919730).

It would be nice to know who it is possible to assign an issue to, and the website already gives us a dropdown list, so the figuring out routine is already there. Cannot be very hard to implement, in my opinion.

Can't Push Project To BitBucket

fields.description:
More specifically the Merge button's functionality only becomes available much later in the page load.

On my connection(250ms latency) the page renders typically in 2-4 seconds and continues to load for another 15-25 seconds. (Total page load is +- 1.2MB and takes 20-30 secs).

If I press the merge button after its rendered but before the page is fully loaded then the browsers loads and displays the JSON result from the /fulfill ajax request instead of the merge dialog.

As such I have to wait until the page loads completely for the Merge button to function and no indication of this is given resulting in me having to reload the page when I clicked the Merge button too early(Within the 15-25 secs of page loading after render).
fields.summary: Pull request page allows interaction before it is ready (BB-10345)

fields.description: Currently .cljs files have no color support, because ClojureScript is not recognized as a language. Please colorize those files as you do it now with .clj files (for Clojure projects).
fields.summary: Color .cljs files the same way as Clojure (.clj)

fields.description:
Contrary to https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2973/users-should-be-able-to-remove-themselves, I don't think users should be able to revoke their own permissions. This matches Stash behavior.

Or if you think they should, there should be a confirm dialog in the way to make sure it is intended.

I just revoked a group permission, and then couldn't get it back because I had revoked my own permission through the group (doh!)
fields.summary: If users can revoke their own permissions, there should be a confirm dialog (BB-10348)

fields.description:
Github will suppress the diff of certain files (Gemfile.lock, binary files over a certain size), which helps with performance for code reviewers when viewing pull requests or commit diffs.

I suggest Bitbucket adds the ability for projects to configure a blacklist of files they wish to not automatically load the diff of in the webview.  Like Github's treatment of Gemfile.lock, you could add a link to show the diff, which would load the content via AJAX.  I think it's important for performance that these supressed diffs are lazy loaded rather than hidden in CSS.

See screenshot for simple concept.

And for configuration, we could just have a textfield that accepts file patterns similar to .gitignore
fields.summary: Supress Diff for certain files (Improve Pull Request Performance)

fields.description:
I need to get a list of files that were changed between commit X and commit Y? These commits do not necessarily follow directly on each other.

This frontend feature is similar to what I require in the API.\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8540/allow-reviewing-of-all-changes-to-all
fields.summary: Changed Files Between Commits (BB-10390)

fields.description:
I'd like to export issues from JIRA to BitBucket.

The use case is probably of interest to Atlassian. We open sourced several internal projects that had been developed with JIRA and BitBucket. It would be convenient and useful to the community for the issues (formerly in JIRA) to migrate with the project to BitBucket. Right now, the JIRA export and BitBucket import options are incompatible. I am unaware of a web service-based migration tool.

I understand that migrating from JIRA to BitBucket won't be possible in all cases, but I suspect a pragmatic solution is possible.

For Atlassian: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-93214 (This issue is not publicly viewable.)
fields.summary: Facilitate issue import from JIRA (BB-10367)

fields.description:
I have been trying to reset my account and am not receiving the password reset email. I have tested sending other emails to the email address I put into the Password Reset field and they work fine. Yet, I've tried resetting the password several times now, and have not received any emails (in either inbox or junk mail).

I'm not sure if you need the email address, but I can provide it if required.
fields.summary: Password reset email not being sent/received

fields.description: Description
fields.summary: Issue title (required)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Add a file with {{@}} in ints name to the repo, e.g. {{foo@bar}}.
# Edit it online.
# Commit.

Expected result: the file is updated.

Actual result: a new file – {{foo%40bar}} is added to the repo; a default commit message also mentions the wrong name.
fields.summary: When online-editing a file with @ (at) in the name a new file created with `%40` instead

fields.description:
When a user closes the bitbucket tab without logging out first, he will stay logged in for days, meaning that everyone with access to this computer can just open bitbucket and is logged in as the previous user. This to me is a serious security flaw.

*An option be added to the login form that allows you to disable the "stay logged in" feature.*
fields.summary: Bitbucket session lives on after closing tab without logout (BB-16187)

fields.description:
I would like to have an issue template for reusable markdown. The markdown would be copied into every new template. For example:

h1. Replicate
Steps to reproduce the issue:

# <first issue>
# <second issue>

h2. Expected Results
<text>h2. Actual Results
<text>
fields.summary: Custom description templates for new issues (BB-10341)

fields.description: Members of a team who aren't administrators (ie. Developers) receive an error when trying to leave a team with no admins.

Show Bamboo build results associated with Pull Request

fields.description:
On the confluence documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=330796872:

updated_on\\
The timestamp of the most recent change to the issue's state. This includes everything from assignee to status. A string in ISO 8601 datetime format (for example, "2013-04-21T03:12:04.660869+00:00"). This string can be null.

When I attempt to import an issues file with updated_on omitted, or with updated_on null:

Issue updated_on: Required datetime field not found: updated_on

I have several keys (I just noticed them in my E-mail) for this problem:\\
f40e5f7f-64e1-4fe8-b545-67d53a73e571\\
b654650c-e5b8-43fd-898d-74cba25af7e7\\
fecac5e9-438b-4277-9f7c-0bccf16e3d1e
fields.summary: In issue tracker import, updated_on for issues is required, although documentation says it is optional or nullable

fields.description:
I have two bitbucket accounts: private and work.\\
I got an invitation to my work team on my work email (which is connected to my bitbucket account).\\
I was logged on my private bitbucket account.\\
When I clicked 'accept invitation' I joined my work team with my private account! (so invitation goes to different account but I override this with my private account) - I think it can be a serious security bug.
fields.summary: Team Invitation override

fields.description:
Trying to start my wiki and preferring using Markdown, I have created my home using the .md extension as specified here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/View+and+edit+pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/View%2Band%2Bedit%2Bpages]

Pushing and accessing the wiki, bitbucket would tell me my Home page doesn't exist.\\
Changing the extension of the page to .markdown resolved the problem. My Home page would show in the wiki.

So the .md extension (and maybe others) is not recognize by bitbucket wiki

Cheers.
fields.summary: .md extensions (and maybe others) are not supported as specified in the help

fields.description:
I forked my private repo one-graphics (https://bitbucket.org/salahaa1/one-graphics)\\
I tried to access the source on the fork (behanceYemen2014) I get (error 500 something went wrong ) .

Tried to clone the new fork from my IDE (netbeans ) I get error message .

regards
fields.summary: Can not access forked repo error 500

fields.description:
I tried to create https://bitbucket.org/davidgarrett/mts but canceled the push when I realized it had over a 1GB of media files.  That corrupted the repo, so I deleted it.  I created a new one with the same name, but it fails to push.  Renaming the new one to MTS-old didn't seem to resolve the issue either.  Can you purge it?  Thanks.

May be related to BCLOUD-8516
fields.summary: Corrupt Repo

fields.description:
I don't like the fact that your username search boxes show all public users by default.  I found out there are several people with the same names and when inviting people to a private repo or managing uses in a private team I don't want the team to inadvertently invite someone else.

How about defaulting to only users assigned to your team or people you've shared to with the option (check box) to show all public users?
fields.summary: Filter private users by default on username search boxes

fields.description: It would be good to see the difference between branches, for example between a dev branch and dev server branch. Currently you just see the diff between each branch and the master.
fields.summary: View diff between branches

fields.description: Thus it is not possible to integrate both solutions without using an add-on which requests access not only to one repo, but to personal account, which is not acceptable in our case.
fields.summary: HipChat issues tokens for API v2 only, while Bitbucket can add hook which uses v1 only
"Pull Request POST" hook not sending any data in request

fields.description: I know it sends email everytime someone add comment to the issue i'm watching on, but i think the Web GUI itself should also indicate the same thing while viewing an issue or at least on the issue list. so that we can identify if someone post some new comments directly on GUI and don't have to rely on emails.
fields.summary: Feature Request : on the issue list, add column for unread comments (BB-10340)

Please suggest if there are any other ways to pay from india, my account will be deactivated on 5th April

Thanks\\
Sreenvias

fields.description:
One picture tells a thousand words:

!4223486052-overview-snippet-issue.png|thumbnail!

I'm using Chromium Version 33.0.1750.152 on Ubuntu 13.10.

The problem is with snippets in following sections:

* I'm starting from scratch
* I have an existing project to push up
* Make changes and push
fields.summary: Bad alignment of code snippets in new repo Overview page.
Updating pull request returns (400) Bad Request

fields.description:
For consistency the search inside of the team page should work the same way that it does from the main dashboard filter, and the navigation level search capability. This is easily reproducible in any team specific search.

Additionally with team members less experienced they may be lead to believe that the repository does not exist, or that they do not have permission to it because the system reports that the repository can not be found.
fields.summary: Searching team projects should search partial project names not just the beginning of the string
